title: Bashar Al-Assad seeks to break his regional isolation after earthquake
description: In search of legitimacy and reconcilliation within the Arab world, the Syrian leader visited the Sultanate of Oman, known for its role as a mediator.

title: Cyclone Freddy heads towards Mozambique after killing five in Madagascar
description: Cyclone Freddy is expected to land Friday in regions between central and southern Mozambique, more than 500 kilometres north of the capital Maputo, and could reach Zimbabwe.

title: How non-Western countries see the war in Ukraine compared to the West
description: A survey by the European Council on Foreign Relations reveals two conflicting visions of the war and the world order, between the Western and the non-Western world.

title: Victim recounts her 'nightmare' ordeal at rape trial of Moroccon pop star Saad Lamjarred
description: Testifying before the Paris Criminal Court on Tuesday, Laura P. again described in detail the hours she spent with the Moroccan singer in October 2016, from their meeting in a nightclub to his Paris hotel room, where she said she was attacked and raped.

title: The war in Ukraine is a catalyst for the energy transition
description: Europeans raised their climate goals as a result of the energy crisis but they face a risk of over-investing in liquefied natural gas infrastructure.

title: In Nigeria, the#EndSARS generation places hope in election
description: Out of the 9 million newly registered voters in Nigeria, more than 7 million are young people. For them, the February 25 presidential election represents a new opportunity.

title: Economist Lael Brainard leaves Fed to advise Biden
description: The Harvard graduate is to head of the National Economic Council where she will be responsible for promoting the US president's record in the run-up to the 2024 election.

title: 'Every step taken by Ukraine's allies raises the question, ‘Then what?’ And most of these questions are unanswered'
description: In their assistance to Kyiv, Western countries have crossed unimaginable thresholds. It remains for them to take back from Putin control of the escalation in a very unpredictable war, writes 'Le Monde' columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Climate: 'The EU emissions trading system is now proving relevant'
description: Derided for a decade for its ineffectiveness, this European carbon tax mechanism is now taking on a new significance, notes 'Le Monde' columnist Philippe Escande.

title: War in Ukraine: Hundreds of thousands killed and wounded on both sides
description: According to Western intelligence estimates, 200,000 Russian soldiers are dead or disabled. The Ukrainian toll is believed to be half that.

title: Berlinale: Alisa Kovalenko's documentary is a goodbye to the Donbas and to childhood
description: 'We Will Not Fade Away', a documentary by the Ukrainian director, follows teenagers about their lives between 2019 and 2022, just before the Russian invasion.

title: The Turkish feminist network supporting women in Antakya after earthquake
description: Turkey's feminist network Kadin Savunmasi offers sanitary pads, underwear and emotional support to disaster victims remaining in the city.

title: Protestors in Paris target TotalEnergies East Africa oil pipeline
description: They demanded that the Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation and Standard Chartered pull back from the East Africa Crude Oil Project, a 1,443-kilometer heated pipeline.

title: Ukrainian General Kyrylo Budanov: 'We are approaching the end of the war'
description: The head of the Ukrainian military intelligence service explains the distortion of information in Russia and why Moscow 'will be forced to withdraw its troops from Ukraine.'

title: Biden calls Russia arms treaty suspension a 'big mistake'
description: The remark followed President Vladimir Putin's announcement that Russia would be exiting the New START arms treaty, the last nuclear arms control pact between the two countries.

title: Palestinians killed in Israeli raid in West Bank
description: The unusual daytime raid led to one of the bloodiest battles in nearly a year of fighting between Israeli troops and Palestinians.

title: In France, teacher stabbed to death by teenage pupil
description: The teacher was killed by a teenage pupil who stormed her Spanish class in a school in southwest France, according to the regional prosecutor.

title: The war in Ukraine is tipping the world into the age of cyberattacks
description: After having been the victim of Russian attacks for so long, Ukraine has built a solid digital defense that has aroused the interest of every expert in the industry. The first lesson is the importance of cooperation between companies and governments.

title: Electrical vehicle push and savings lift Stellantis results
description: The automaker beat forecasts on Wednesday with a 17% rise in operating profit for the second half of last year.

title: Ukraine: One war, two differing world views
description: The speeches by Vladimir Putin and Joe Biden recalled the rhetoric of the Cold War. But the situation today – with a war in Europe, China on the prowl and international order in tatters – is much more complex.

title: Ex-IS bride Shamima Begum loses bid to restore UK citizenship
description: A special immigration appeals commission decided the revocation of the 23-year-old's citizenship was lawful.

title: In Poland, Biden presents himself as the defender of the free world, rejects any weakening in Ukraine support
description: 'Our support for Ukraine will not waver, NATO will not be divided, and we will not tire,' the US president assured, before attacking Vladimir Putin, 'a dictator bent on rebuilding an empire.'

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Sales process and prices infuriate many ticket hopefuls
description: Buyers are offered a limited choice of events and some sports are already inaccessible. Above all, the prices are considered too high by many people.

title: Inflation, Russia exit weigh on Danone's annual results
description: The world's-largest yogurt maker's profits were halved in 2022.

title: War in Ukraine: How many refugees are in Europe one year after the beginning of the war?
description: Twelve months after the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, around 18% of the Ukrainian population has fled, mainly to Poland, the Czech Republic and Germany.

title: The nomadic life of Russian exiles, one year after the start of Moscow's Ukraine invasion
description: Since Russia stormed Ukraine in February 2022, hundreds of thousands of Russians have been leaving their homeland. Some return, sort out a few things and then leave again. Companies are trying to counter the brain drain.

title: Nigerian presidential election: How Bola Tinubu became the master of Lagos
description: A Yoruba Muslim, the majority party candidate governed Lagos state between 1999 and 2007 and still holds great sway in the country's economic capital.

title: 'In Nigeria, oil theft can affect as much as 25% of production'
description: In an interview, Bertrand Monnet, an expert on organized crime, examines the motives behind oil diversions and piracy in the Niger Delta.

title: US agrees to extradite Peru's former President Toledo
description: Toledo will face corruption charges back in Peru of negotiating bribes up to $20 million. Toledo has denied soliciting or receiving bribes.

title: NASA urged to launch mission to Uranus for key insights into solar system formation
description: For mechanical reasons, the ambitious orbiter mission must be launched by 2032 at the latest to guarantee arrival in 2044.

title: Germany welcomes a million Ukrainian refugees in one year
description: Over one million Ukrainian refugees arrived in Germany in 2022, more than all the migrants who arrived between 2014 and 2016. Many German companies, faced with a shortage of labor, are playing a vital role in their welcome.

title: China struggles to compete with ChatGPT in the AI race
description: The chatbot developed by the American OpenAI fascinates Chinese internet users and makes them wonder about the capabilities of their domestic tech giants, who are lagging behind.

title: Cyclone Freddy: 'A monster with atypical characteristics' threatens Madagascar
description: According to Emmanuel Cloppet, Météo France's director for the Indian Ocean, a phenomenon of such intensity has rarely been seen in this area.

title: Putin suspends New START, the last Russian-American nuclear disarmament treaty
description: Despite the suspension of the arms control agreement signed with the United States in 2010, Moscow will continue to respect the limitation on its nuclear arsenal, the Russian Foreign Ministry assured.

title: Putin glorifies a Russia under attack in his address to the nation
description: The Russian president also announced the suspension of Moscow's participation in the New START nuclear disarmament treaty.
